meanings.definition: Stretched or pulled to the limit
meanings.sent1: The old rope looked strained and ready to snap.
meanings.sent2: The strained muscles in his arms ached after lifting the heavy boxes.
meanings.sent3: The strained rubber band made a funny noise when it finally snapped.
meanings.sent4: Her strained smile did not hide the sadness in her eyes.
meanings.sent5: The strained relationship between the two countries led to a tense standoff.

meanings.definition: Showing signs of tension or effort
meanings.sent1: Her strained voice revealed her nervousness during the presentation.
meanings.sent2: The strained expression on his face indicated his struggle with the difficult task.
meanings.sent3: The strained silence in the room made everyone feel uncomfortable.
meanings.sent4: The strained atmosphere at the meeting was palpable.
meanings.sent5: His strained attempt at humor fell flat with the audience.

meanings.definition: Filtered or extracted by passing through a sieve or cloth
meanings.sent1: The strained yogurt had a smooth and creamy texture.
meanings.sent2: She used a strained to separate the seeds from the freshly squeezed juice.
meanings.sent3: The strained tea leaves left a residue at the bottom of the cup.
meanings.sent4: The strained broth was clear and free of impurities.
meanings.sent5: The strained pasta sauce was thick and rich in flavor.

meanings.definition: Forced or unnatural in manner or tone
meanings.sent1: Her strained laughter sounded forced and insincere.
meanings.sent2: He gave a strained apology that did not seem genuine.
meanings.sent3: The strained conversation felt awkward and uncomfortable.
meanings.sent4: His strained performance on stage lacked authenticity.
meanings.sent5: The strained dialogue in the movie felt contrived and artificial.
